thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Baseball Training Equipment (ORD-2118)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Develops Baseball Training Equipment (ORD-2118) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Baseball Training Equipment (ORD-2118)
text:
One of America's leading invention submission companies, InventHelp is submitting the SWING MASTER to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 16, 2015
"I wanted to help young ball players and their parents to understand the mechanics of a proper swing," said an inventor from Debary, Fla. "I came up with this training aid to assist young players in developing their swings to a professional level."
He developed the SWING MASTER to help develop hip and lower-body rotation, while also improving back-foot rotation. The accessory keeps hands in the strike zone and also keeps hands inside the baseball. The device creates a shorter swing to the ball and generates faster bat speed. It exercises and strengthens the hands, wrists, forearms, triceps and biceps. Additionally, the invention turns the player into a better hitter. It can be used at all levels of baseball (T-ball to pros). Product samples are available.
The original design was submitted to the Orlando office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-ORD-2118, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
